title: Sudan: Electricity Consumption Comes Down By a Quarter During the 3days of Eid Adha
text:
Sudan: Russia Affirms Its Keenness to Play Positive Role for Enhancing Sudan - South Sudan Relations 
Khartoum — Electricity consumption has gone down by a quarter, from 2000 megawatt a day to 1500 megawatts a day, according to the Director of the General company for Electricity Distribution, Eng. Abdul Rahman Hajjaj. 
Hajjaj said the drop in consumption was attributed to the closure of factories and industrial areas during the 3-day holiday with the consumption remaining in the residential areas only. 
Hajjaj said Khartoum state, consumes 60% of the overall electricity consumption and that in Khartoum electricity consumption went down by 40% in Khartoum during the same period. 
He said the company tends to invest more on hydroelectricity in place of the thermal production which is very expense. 
He revealed that company will also effect maintenance works during the month of November when consumption comes down because of the cold season when people consume less and there will less demand for the service. Sudan
